comments:
Using Tomcat 5.5.9 on the 7/19 i-build; the server was running and I executed a
"debug on server" command for a JSP that belonged to a dynamic web project
already deployed to the server; as expected, it offered to restart in debugging
mode but the shutdown hung.

Hi Rob,

I couldn't reproduce with 5.5.9 or another version I tried. Can you reproduce
every time, or is there something I might be missing?

Just tried again and I was able to repro; some other odd things I'm seeing: 
-even when I stop the server I get a dialog asking me if I'd like "start in
debug mode" due to the breakpoints in the workspace
-when I execute a debug on server, I get both a "must restart in debugging mode"
dialog following by the dialog that asks if I want to start in debug mode due to
the breakpoints
-when I killed my test eclipse I was left with a dialog indicating that it was
waiting for the publish step to complete (no cancel or close on that dialog)

Need to redo this with tracing on for Tomcat..

OK, tracing didn't really clear anything up but it is successfully stopping and
starting before it hangs (I'm assuming this is a deadlock involving the various
IServerListeners and other threads that are created during server start - I'm
going to have to debug the execution to figure out what's going on); externally
stopping the Tomcat server broke the deadlock and allowed the debugging session
to launch (although it failed since the server was terminated).

Probably won't be much help, but here's the tracing output (I've noted with a
***hang*** where it hung; that stack trace is one I included in an existing
Trace call so ignore)

I am also having trouble reproducing this.  I'm curious if there is anything in 
the dynamic web project beyond some simple "test" JSPs?

Tomcat has the "feature" of hanging during shutdown if a webapp doesn't fully 
clean itselft up.  However, it takes a bit of effort to create a webapp that 
exhibits this behavior.

Given the age and number of code changes since the bug was reported, I'm going to assume that this issue is no longer a problem.  Though the hang actually occurred, I'm marking it as WORKSFORME to avoid implying that any changes were made to address this particular issue. If the issue resurfaces, a new bug report with new details would probably be appropriate.
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
